results.name: Self-inverse permutation of natural numbers induced by the restriction of A243057 (or A243059 or A242420) to the union of {1} and A102750.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..126
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: a(1) = 1, and for n>1, a(n) = 1 + A243285(A243057(A102750(n-1))). [Note: instead of A243057 one can also use A243059 or A242420.]
example: With n=7, the seventh number in the complement of A070003 (i.e. in the union of {1} and A102750) is A102750(6) = 10. When A243057 (or A243059) is applied to it, the result is another number that is a member of A102750, in this case 15, which occurs there as A102750(11). Thus a(7) = 11+1 = 12.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 02 2014
